apiSpec.description: A reference to the API spec this metadata file is linked to
apiSpec.title: API Spec

connectorGav.description: This is the Maven GAV the generated connector will get.
connectorGav.title: Connector GAV

connectorCategory.description: Defines the category the generated connector will have.
connectorCategory.title: Connector Category

extensionXml.description: Defines the value for the @Xml annotation that will be used when generating the Extension class of the connector.
extensionXml.title: Extension Xml

baseJavaPackage.description: Defines the base Java package the generated connector will have. Sub packages will be created depending on this value.
baseJavaPackage.title: Base Java Package

skipOutputTypeValidation.description:
GET, POST, PATCH and OPTIONS operations are required to define a type for it's body.
Use this property to avoid this check and generate a connector that does not declare a type for it's body.
skipOutputTypeValidation.title: Skip Output Type Validation

defaultInputMediaType.description:
Allows to select the input media type for all of the operations.
This value gets overriden if a value is present at the operation level.
If the API defines possible media types this value must be one of those.
If the API does not define possible media types this value can be anything.
defaultInputMediaType.title: Default Input media Type

defaultOutputMediaType.description:
Allows to select the output media type for all of the operations.
This value gets overriden if a value is present at the operation level.
If the API defines possible media types this value must be one of those.
If the API does not define possible media types this value can be anything.
defaultOutputMediaType.title: Default Output Media Type

^.*$.description: Declares the pagination strategies that will be used with an API.
^.*$.title: Pagination Declarations

paginations.description: Declares the pagination strategies that will be used with an API.
paginations.title: Pagination Declarations

^.*$.description: Allows customizing the authentication methods to be used within this API
^.*$.title: Security

security.description: Allows customizing the authentication methods to be used within this API
security.title: Security

queryParameterArrayFormat.description:
Defines how query parameters that represent arrays should be formatted
i.e. comma: key=value1,value2  multimap: key=value1&key=value2
queryParameterArrayFormat.title: Query Parameter Array Format

testConnection.description: Allows defining a way of validating the connection for the generated connector.
testConnection.title: Test Connection

^.*$.description: A list of trigger definitions for this connector.
^.*$.title: Triggers

triggers.description: A list of trigger definitions for this connector.
triggers.title: Triggers

operationDisplayName.description:
If provided, the default naming mechanism will not be used for the connector generation and it will default to this the provided expression.
At the moment, the supported bindings will be `operationId`, `method`, `path` and `summary`
operationDisplayName.title: Hook to replace the display naming generation for operations

operationIdentifier.description:
If provided, the default naming mechanism will not be used for the connector generation and it will default to this the provided expression.
At the moment, the supported bindings will be `operationId`, `method` and `path`
operationIdentifier.title: Hook to replace the identifier generation for operations

parameterIdentifier.description:
If provided, the default naming mechanism will not be used for the connector generation and it will default to this the provided expression.
At the moment, the supported bindings will be `name` and `parameterType` (with possible values 'URI', 'HEADER' and 'QUERY')
parameterIdentifier.title: Hook to replace the identifier generation for parameters

bodyIdentifier.description:
If provided, the default naming mechanism will not be used for the connector generation and it will default to this the provided expression.
At the moment, the supported bindings will be `operationId`, `method`, `path` and `partName` (might be null, in case of single body)
bodyIdentifier.title: Hook to replace the identifier generation for parameters

ignoreOperations.description:
If set to true, all operations and triggers will be ignored unless explicitly set as not ignored.
If set to false, all operations and triggers will be generated unless explicitly ignored.
ignoreOperations.title: Ignore Operations Globally

sidecar.description: Generate operations and triggers as sidecars.
sidecar.title: Generate operations and triggers as sidecars

description: Declares the metadata that Rest SDK needs in order to process an API and generate a connector from it.
title: Connector Descriptor

Argument.description: An assignation of a value for a parameter.
Argument.title: Argument

binding.description: Allows defining the uri parameters, query parameters, headers and body that will be sent in the HTTP request using expressions.
binding.title: HTTP Request's binding

HttpRequest.description: A description of an http request.
HttpRequest.title: Http Request

HttpRequestBinding.description: Allows defining the uri parameters, query parameters, headers and body that will be sent in the HTTP request using expressions.
HttpRequestBinding.title: HTTP Request Binding

^.*$.description: Declares the parameters that the resolver will receive as arguments and that can be used internally.
^.*$.title: Resolver Declarations's parameter

parameters.description: Declares the parameters that the resolver will receive as arguments and that can be used internally.
parameters.title: Resolver Declarations's parameter

definition.description: The resolver definition of that is being declared.
definition.title: Resolver Declarations's definition

ResolverDeclaration.description: A declaration of a resolver. This includes the name, definition, and input parameters of the resolver.
ResolverDeclaration.title: Resolver Declaration

id.description: The Id of the resolver declaration that is being referenced.
id.title: Resolver Reference's id

^.*$.description: The arguments that will be passed to the resolver declaration. These must match the declared parameters.
^.*$.title: Resolver Reference's argument

arguments.description: The arguments that will be passed to the resolver declaration. These must match the declared parameters.
arguments.title: Resolver Reference's argument

ResolverReference.description: A reference to a resolver declaration.
ResolverReference.title: Resolver Reference

type.description: Declares the data type of a parameter.
type.title: Parameter Type

ResolverParameter.description: A parameter declaration for a resolver.
ResolverParameter.title: Resolver Parameter

definition.description: The resolver definition of that is being declared.
definition.title: Resolver Declarations's definition

allOf.description: A declaration of a sample data resolver.
allOf.title: Sample Data Declaration

id.description: The Id of the resolver declaration that is being referenced.
id.title: Resolver Reference's id

allOf.description: A reference to a sample data declaration.
allOf.title: Sample Data Reference

request.description: An http request data expression that the sample data resolver will use to get the sample data.
request.title: Simple Sample Data Definition's request

transform.description: An script data expression that processes the http request result.
transform.title: Simple Sample Data Definition's transformation

allOf.description: The definition of a sample data resolver that does an HTTP request and optionally a transformation on its result.
allOf.title: Sample Data HTTP Definition

result.description: A data expression that generates the sample data result.
result.title: Sample Data Definition's result

allOf.description: A definition of a sample data resolver that allows using a custom data expression.
allOf.title: Sample Data Custom Definition

allOf.description: A sample data definition that will automatically match the operation/trigger result.
allOf.title: Sample Data Same Operation Definition

definition.description: The resolver definition of that is being declared.
definition.title: Resolver Declarations's definition

allOf.description: A declaration of a value provider resolver.
allOf.title: Value Provider Declaration

id.description: The Id of the resolver declaration that is being referenced.
id.title: Resolver Reference's id

allOf.description: A reference to a value provider declaration.
allOf.title: Value Provider Reference

request.description: The request the value provider should make to get the values from the server.
request.title: Value Provider's Request

items.description: An specification on how to extract the relevant parts from the value provider server response.
items.title: Value Provider's Items

allOf.description: The actual definition of a value provider.
allOf.title: Value Provider Definition

^.*$.description: A A list of the parameters the generated operation adapter will expose to the connector user.
^.*$.title: Auxiliar Parameters

parameters.description: A A list of the parameters the generated operation adapter will expose to the connector user.
parameters.title: Auxiliar Parameters

sampleData.description: The sample data expression to use.
sampleData.title: Sample Data

extraction.description: An expression used to extract the items array from the server response.
extraction.title: Value Provider Item Extraction

value.description: An expression used to extract the actual value from an item.
value.title: Value Provider Item Value

displayName.description: An expression that will be used to extract the name the user will see for a value from an item. If this expression is not provided the value will be used as display name.
displayName.title: Value Provider Item Display Name

ValueProviderItems.description: Defines how the specific values will be extracted from the value provider’s server response.
ValueProviderItems.title: Value Provider Items

^.*$.description: A A list of the parameters the generated trigger will expose to the connector user.
^.*$.title: Trigger Parameters

binding.description: A list containing all the parameter bindings.
binding.title: Parameter Bindings

items.title: Trigger Items

watermark.description: Allows defining how the watermark should be extracted from the server response.
watermark.title: Trigger Watermark

event.description: DW expression which reshapes the output event.
event.title: Trigger Event

identity.description: Allows defining how the items identity should be extracted from the server response.
identity.title: Trigger Identity

body.description: Allows defining an expression that will generate the request body for the source request to the server.

body.description: Allows defining an expression that will generate the request body for the source request to the server.
body.title: Body Binding

body.description: Allows defining an expression that will generate the request body for the source request to the server.

Allows to define or override the input type for an operation using a JSON or XSD Schema.

ParameterBinding.description:
A parameter binding.
This binding defines the actual values -Or expressions- of the parameters that will be sent to the server.
ParameterBinding.title: Parameter Binding

typeSchema.description:
Allows to define or override the input type for an operation using a JSON or XSD Schema.
It's value should be the relativa path to a schema that will be used as the input type for the operation.
typeSchema.title: Type Schema

mediaType.description: Media type to use when executing this operation.
mediaType.title: Media type

BodyBinding.description: Allows defining an expression that will generate the response body from the server along with its media type and schema.
BodyBinding.title: Body Binding

extraction.description: Allows defining an expression that extracts the watermark from the server response.
extraction.title: Trigger Watermark Extraction

type.description:
Indicates the data type of the watermark.
This will be used for correctly comparing watermarks (ie. number and dates should be compared in different ways)
type.title: Trigger Watermark Type

TriggerWatermark.description: Allows defining how the watermark should be extracted from the server response.
TriggerWatermark.title: Trigger Watermark

extraction.description: Allows defining an expression that will be used to get the items array from the server response.
extraction.title: Trigger Item Extraction

TriggerItems.description: Allows defining how the actual items should be extracted from the server response.
TriggerItems.title: Trigger Items

extraction.description: Allows defining an expression that extracts the identity of an item from the server response.
extraction.title: Trigger Identity Extraction

TriggerIdentity.description: Allows defining how the items identity should be extracted from the server response.
TriggerIdentity.title: Trigger Identity

extraction.description: Allows defining an expression that reshapes the item from the server response.
extraction.title: Trigger Event Extraction

TriggerEvent.description: DW expression which reshapes the output event.
TriggerEvent.title: Trigger Event

path.description:
Indicates a path relative to the base uri where the connector can make a request to test if the connectivity is
working as intended.
path.title: Test Connection Path

method.description:
Defines the method to use when making the request to the testConnectionPath.
The default request method to be used is get.
method.title: Test Connection Method

items.description:
A group of the expected status codes for the response of the request made to the testConnectionPath by the validate
connection method. If the response status code is not present in this list, it will be considered an invalid connection.
If this property is not set, rest SDK will check for a 200 status code.
items.title: Test Connection Valid Status Codes

anyOf.description:
A group of the expected status codes for the response of the request made to the testConnectionPath by the validate
connection method. If the response status code is not present in this list, it will be considered an invalid connection.
If this property is not set, rest SDK will check for a 200 status code.
anyOf.title: Test Connection Valid Status Codes

mediaType.description:
The media type of the server response body.
Rest SDK will try to get it from the content-type header, use this property if the response does not have a content-type
header or if you want to override it.
mediaType.title: Test Connetion Media Type

items.description: Allows defining a set of validations to be run against the server response to check if the connection is valid.
items.title: Test Connection Response Validation

anyOf.description: Allows defining a set of validations to be run against the server response to check if the connection is valid.
anyOf.title: Test Connection Response Validation

TestConnection.description:
Allows defining a way of validating the connection for the generated connector.
This property can be declared globally and it will get used for all the secuirty schemes defined in the API.
You can also define different test connection properties at a security scheme level.
TestConnection.title: Test Connection

validation.description:
An expression used to validate the HTTP test connection request's response.
This expression must return true if the response is valid or false if it is not.
Rest SDK will assing the body and attributes of the server response to the 'payload' and 'attributes' vars respectively.
validation.title: Test Connection Validation Expression

errorTemplate.description:
Allows defining a message to be shown to the user if the connection validation fails.
A default error telling that the validation expression failed will be shown if this expression is not defined.
errorTemplate.title: Test Connection Error Template

TestConnectionResponseValidation.description: Defines a validation that must be run against the server response to check if a connection is valid.
TestConnectionResponseValidation.title: Test Connection Response Validation

url.description: The URL of the API spec this metadata file is linked to
url.title: API Spec URL

MavenGav.description: The maven's group, artifact and version that will be used when identifying an asset.
MavenGav.title: Maven GAV

type.description:
Defines the type of the the pagination strategy being declared. i.e. offset based pagination.
Allowed types are: offset, marker, pageNumber and hypermedia.
type.title: Pagination Type

PaginationDeclaration.description: Declares a pagination startegy that will be used with an API.
PaginationDeclaration.title: Pagination Declaration

parameters.description: Declares the parameters that will be used within a pagination strategy.
parameters.title: Pagination Parameters

allOf.description: Declares an offset pagination startegy that will be used with an API.
allOf.title: Offset Pagination Declaration

parameters.title: Pagination Parameters

allOf.description: Declares a hypermedia pagination startegy that will be used with an API.

offsetParamName.description: the name of the query param that carries the value of the pagination (offset, pageNumber, token, etc).
offsetParamName.title: Pagination Parameter Name

initialOffset.description: Initial offset value to handle on the first offset-based paging http request.
initialOffset.title: Initial Offset

pagingResponse.description: Defines the way a pagination parameter will be extracted from an http response.
pagingResponse.title: Pagination Response Expression

OffsetPaginationParameters.description: Declares a parameter that will be used within a pagination strategy.
OffsetPaginationParameters.title: Pagination Parameter

nextTokenParamName.description: the name of the query param that carries the value of the pagination (offset, pageNumber, token, etc).
nextTokenParamName.title: Pagination Parameter Name

nextToken.description: the DW expression used to extract the next token from the response in marker-based pagination request.
nextToken.title: Next Token Expression

pagingResponse.description: Defines the way a pagination parameter will be extracted from an http response.
pagingResponse.title: Pagination Response Expression

MarkerPaginationParameters.description: Declares a parameter that will be used within a pagination strategy.
MarkerPaginationParameters.title: Pagination Parameter

pageNumberParamName.description: the name of the query param that carries the value of the pagination (offset, pageNumber, token, etc).
pageNumberParamName.title: Pagination Parameter Name

pageCount.description: The DW expression used to extract the total page count from the response in page-number pagination request.
pageCount.title: Page count

initialPageNumber.description: the initial page to get in the first pageNumber-based to handle in a http request.
initialPageNumber.title: Initial Page Number

pagingResponse.description: Defines the way a pagination parameter will be extracted from an http response.
pagingResponse.title: Pagination Response Expression

PageNumberPaginationParameters.description: Declares a parameter that will be used within a pagination strategy.
PageNumberPaginationParameters.title: Pagination Parameter

nextUrl.description: the DW expression used to extract the next URL from the response in hypermedia-based pagination request.
nextUrl.title: Next Url Expression

pagingResponse.description: Defines the way a pagination parameter will be extracted from an http response.
pagingResponse.title: Pagination Response Expression

HypermediaPaginationParameters.description: Declares a parameter that will be used within a pagination strategy.
HypermediaPaginationParameters.title: Pagination Parameter

description.description: Human readable description of the operation.

inputType.description:
Allows to define or override the input type for an operation using a JSON or XSD Schema.
It's value should be the relativa path to a schema that will be used as the input type for the operation.
inputType.title: Input Type

inputMediaType.description: Input media type to use when executing this operation.
inputMediaType.title: Input media type

outputType.description:
Allows to define or override the output type for an operation using a JSON or XSD Schema.
It's value should be the relativa path to a schema that will be used as the output type for the operation.
outputType.title: Output Type

ignored.description: Indicates if a node should be ignored.
ignored.title: Ignored

baseUri.title: Alternative base URI reference

pagination.description:
Defines that a pagination strategy should be used for this operation.
The value must match the name of a declared pagination strategy.
pagination.title: Pagination Reference

skipOutputTypeValidation.description:
GET, POST, PATCH and OPTIONS operations are required to define a type for it's body.
Use this property to avoid this check and generate a connector that does not declare a type for it's body.
skipOutputTypeValidation.title: Skip Output Type Validation

voidOperation.description:
GET, POST, PATCH and OPTIONS operations are required to define a type for it's body.
Use this property to declare one of those operations' responses as bodyless.
Doing this will cause rest SDK to generate different code for that operation.
voidOperation.title: Void Operation

Defines how query parameters that represent arrrays should be formatted
i.e. comma: key=value1,value2  multimap: key=value1&key=value2
queryParameterArrayFormat.title: Query Parameter Array Format

sampleData.title: Sample Data

operationIdentifier.title: Hook to replace the identifier for a given operation
